reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Regional Nppo And Partners Taskforce Meeting For Cpm-13

description.narrative: The meeting aims to give an opportunity to West Africa NPPOs taskforce to discuss regional priorities and agree on subjects of concerns and common positions to address during the Commission on Phytosanitary Measures (CPM-13) meeting planned from April 16-20, 2018 in Rome-Italy. Program content includes - West Africa NPPO taskforce priorities - Presentation of North American Plant Protection Organization (NAPPO) experience - Review and discuss West Africa NPPO taskforce mission and action plan for 2018 - Review and discuss on priority plant protection issues in West Africa - Preparation of the upcoming Commission on Phytosanitary Measures (CPM-13) - Review CPM-12 report and Review of pending disputes - Identify, discuss and Agree on common subjects and positions to address during the (CPM-13). Having the opportunity to discuss subjects of concerns and common positions to address during the CPM meeting has been a big challenge for West Africa NPPOs for many years. Thus, with this meeting APHIS wish to initiate a regional consultation process to help promote regional harmonization of plant pests regulations and monitoring strategies through the application of international plant health standards.

participating-org.narrative: Animal And Plant Health Inspection Service
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: In 2005, after 15 years of economic stagnation and political instability, Togo started along a gradual path to democratic reform. Since then, Togo has held several elections deemed free and fair by international observers, including a presidential election in April 2015. Togo has also sought to liberalize business regulations, trade policies, and worked to re-engage with the international community. The United States, along with the rest of the international community, aims to encourage the Government of Togo (GOT) to further political and economic reforms. FY 2017 assistance seeks to develop a professionalized military that respects civilian leadership and democratic institutions.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
